clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Systematic Nursing Orientations in the Reduction of Predicted Cardiovascular Risk in Patients With Coronary Artery Disease.
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Systematic Nursing Orientations in the Reduction of Predicted Cardiovascular Risk in Patients With Coronary Artery Disease.

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the impact of systematic nursing orientations in the reduction of predicted cardiovascular risk in patients with coronary artery disease during four nursing visits for a 1-year period and compare to a group of patients submitted to conventional treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: Assess 184 (two groups) patients during four nursing visits for a 1-year period and compare to a group of patients submitted to conventional treatment. We will evaluate the impact of systematic nursing orientations in the reduction of predicted cardiovascular risk in patients with coronary artery disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Knowledge of the risk factors and the adhesion to pharmacology treatment; Reduction of the modified risk factors in the previous knowledge of patients and their adhesion;

arm_group.description: Two groups: control - conventional care intervention - systematic education in the reduction of the risk estimate to cardiovascular events

intervention.intervention_name: Systematic education in the reduction of the risk estimate to cardiovascular events
intervention.description: Systematic education during 4 assessment throughout one year
